comment: Professor P is great and hilarious. She's super caring about her students and is willing to help you when you're struggling. Her pop-quizzes are easy, but you have to do a lot of reading. Her tests are easy as well, but please show up to get a good grade on them. Excited for the final project, which btw is a huge chunk of the grade. She's amazing!

Great professor, lots of group discussions in class. Make sure to do the friday stuff, as well as the readings (theres a couple of pop quizzes on them in class and you'll just get more out of the class if you do).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: great at teaching, lots of in class discussions, exams are written not mc

She is one of the most understanding and caring professors I have ever had at Kennesaw. I took her summer course and the work was not too difficult, however the test do require textbook reading. But overall highly recommend this class and professor! So So Good!

I took Prof. P's POLS 1101 asynchronous summer course and it was great. She has a structured and easy to follow way of teaching the course and isn't in the way of things but is available when needed. Just be sure to stay on top of yourself and keep yourself on a schedule and you'll be fine. Easy A's on assignments & tests if not 100s.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Her assignments are boring, long, and take a ton of time. Not to mention her tests being ridiculously long (they were originally 100 questions and now 75), and extremely nitpicky questions. You have to search through the book to find the answers. Took most of us 2-3 hours to complete a test. Shes too difficult of a grader on weekly assignments too
I don't have a problem with Professor personally at all, BUT HER TESTS ARE IMPOSSIBLE, THEY ARE 100 QUESTIONS AND ARE SO HARD.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Professor Pincock was decent. She gave out a weekly assignment every week but they were typically long and time-consuming. (I thought so because I had other classes and a part-time job). They were not especially hard but required extensive research to complete. Her tests were 1-2 hours long and not easy. Not bad but not my favorite professor.
Just not that good of a professor, doesnt make class fun. K a r e n
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Dr Pincock is really great! Had a wonderful time in the class and I learned a lot. She really cares for her students. Class wasnt too hard. Two papers and a couple of smaller assignments. No tests, and overall the class was a lot of fun.

Took her for a 2 week summer class and loved it. I participated in this class more than any other in the 4 yrs I've been at KSU & it's not dreadful. All assignments were essays. Participate, show up to class and skim through your readings and you'll get an A. She's knowledgeable about the subject & is there for you. Would definitely take her again!

I love this professor very intelligent and knowledgeable about the material she teaches. She wants her students to learn and enjoy and creates the appropriate environment. Definitely take and if you put in the appropriate work you will have nothing to worry about.
Makes classes fun. Very participatory. Skills learned are valuable to all interpersonal relationships, not just alternative dispute resolution. All my classmates liked the class.
AWESOME professor. Great class. Never miss a class and be on time.  Tons of writing but Professor Pincock is very helpful if you have a hard time understanding what she expects.
